page.title: 01Overall View Of The Area
page.content: A unique feature of this study block is Horsey Island. It is not an island in the real sense but an area of reclaimed land. Horsey Ridge is a dyke which held back the estury when dutch engineers reclaimed the land.In the area of our 12sq.km study block there is a noticeable amount of the fish,{salmon}in the estury. Viewed from above the 12sq.km study block appears to be a low lying waste land known locally as Braunton Burrows and Braunton Marsh.Closer inspection reveals two distinct landscapes. The { {Burrows}is mainly sand dune caused by the prevailing S.W winds sweeping in from the Atlantic Ocean. The {Marsh} is an area of flat fertile land bordering the River Taw. A notable feature of the study block is the joint estury shared by River Taw and River Torridge.
